original_title: Central Bank announces official USD exchange rates
original_body_lines: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka has announced the official US Dollar exchange rates for Friday (March 10), declaring the buying as Rs. 311.62 and the selling rate as Rs. 328.90.
This marks an uptick in the buying and selling rates in comparison to the figures published yesterday.
As per Central Bank’s figures yesterday, the buying and selling rates were at Rs. 307.36 and Rs. 325.52 per USD, respectively.
The Middle Rate of the USD/LKR SPOT exchange rate was recorded at Rs. 318.63 today.
Meanwhile, several leading licensed commercial banks in Sri Lanka today declared their buying rate of USD as Rs. 310, and the selling rate ranged between Rs. 325 - Rs. 330.
